abstract: Apple’s new phone does so many things so well, and so pleasurably, that you tend to forgive its foibles.
snippet: Apple’s new phone does so many things so well, and so pleasurably, that you tend to forgive its foibles.
lead_paragraph: Talk about hype. In the last six months, Apple’s iPhone has been the subject of 11,000 print articles, and it turns up about 69 million hits on Google. Cultists are camping out in front of Apple stores; bloggers call it the “Jesus phone.” All of this before a single consumer has even touched the thing.

headline.main: The iPhone Matches Most of Its Hype

abstract: As Silicon Valley undergoes a resurgence, companies like Google, Yahoo and Apple are again looking for space to grow.
snippet: As Silicon Valley undergoes a resurgence, companies like Google, Yahoo and Apple are again looking for space to grow.
lead_paragraph: REDWOOD CITY, Calif. — A glittery blue office tower in downtown San Jose may well be the perfect symbol for Silicon Valley’s resurgence.

headline.main: In Silicon Valley, Steady but Cautious Growth Returns
headline.print_headline: In Silicon Valley, Steady but Cautious Growth Returns

abstract: A new service called MySpace TV will be set up as an independent Web site that people can visit to share and watch video.
snippet: A new service called MySpace TV will be set up as an independent Web site that people can visit to share and watch video.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, June 26 — Two years ago, millions of MySpace users began adding video clips to their profile pages, helping to give rise to YouTube, which Google bought last October for $1.65 billion.

headline.main: MySpace, Chasing YouTube, Upgrades Its Offerings
headline.print_headline: MySpace, Chasing YouTube, Upgrades Its Offerings

lead_paragraph: Q. How do I use S.M.T.P. and P.O.P. in setting up e-mail programs?

abstract: Search engines have shortcuts to all kinds of information, like stock quotes and gasoline prices, even song lyrics.
snippet: Search engines have shortcuts to all kinds of information, like stock quotes and gasoline prices, even song lyrics.
lead_paragraph: TIP OF THE WEEK: Search engines have shortcuts to all kinds of information, like stock quotes and gasoline prices, even song lyrics. In Google or Yahoo, for example, type in phrases like "teaspoons in a pint" and hit the Search button to get unit and measuring information. Both sites can also give you basic currency conversions: Type in "1 USD in GBP" to get a rough idea of the dollar's strength against the British pound sterling. There's more information for using these features at www.google.com/help/features.html and at tools.search.yahoo.com/shortcuts.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Search Engines
